Helvetra is not affiliated with Apertus but chose to build on it because we believe in its mission. Learn more at Swiss AI, EPFL AI, and ETH AI.

Your data stays in Switzerland, no queries are stored, and the energy used is recovered for heating. Helvetra is not affiliated with Infomaniak. We simply chose them because they align with our values. Learn more.

privacy.title: Privacy by Design

independence.text2: We use Apertus and Infomaniak because they align with our values, not because we're affiliated. We pay standard fees like any customer. Our only obligation is to you.

meta.title: Helvetra vs Google Translate: Which Is Right for You?
meta.description: An honest comparison of Helvetra and Google Translate. We break down privacy, features, pricing, and Swiss language support to help you choose the right translation tool.

google.title: Helvetra vs Google Translate
google.subtitle: Two free translation tools built on fundamentally different philosophies. Here's an honest look at where each one shines — and where it falls short.

intro.p1: If you've ever needed to translate something, you've probably used Google Translate. It's everywhere — built into Chrome, Android, and countless apps. It's free, it's fast, and it supports over 130 languages. For most people, it's the default choice.
intro.p2: Helvetra takes a different approach. Instead of trying to translate everything for everyone, we focus on doing one thing well: private, high-quality translation for Swiss languages. Neither tool is objectively "better" — it depends entirely on what you need. Let's break it down honestly.

googleWins.title: Where Google Translate Wins

coverage.title: Unmatched Language Coverage
coverage.p1: Google Translate supports 133 languages — from Afrikaans to Zulu, including many regional and endangered languages. If you need to translate Thai, Swahili, or Welsh, Google is essentially your only free option. Helvetra supports five languages (German, French, Italian, English, and Swiss German), which covers Switzerland well but won't help you on a trip to Tokyo.
coverage.p2: This isn't a weakness we're trying to fix. Helvetra is intentionally focused on Swiss languages because that's where we can add real value. If you regularly work with languages outside this scope, Google Translate is the practical choice.

free.title: Truly Unlimited and Free
free.p1: Google Translate has no character limits, no daily caps, and no premium tier you're being nudged toward. You can translate entire documents, websites, even real-time conversations — all without paying a cent or creating an account. This is possible because Google's business model doesn't rely on charging for translation; it relies on the data you provide while using the service.

ecosystem.title: Deep Ecosystem Integration
ecosystem.p1: Google Translate is woven into the fabric of the internet. Right-click any text in Chrome and translate it. Point your phone camera at a sign in a foreign language and see the translation overlaid in real-time. Have a conversation with someone who speaks a different language using the app's conversation mode. If you live in Google's ecosystem, the convenience is hard to beat.

googleWins.verdict: Bottom line: If you need to translate exotic languages, want unlimited free usage, or love the convenience of Google's ecosystem integration, Google Translate is genuinely excellent at what it does.

helvetraWins.title: Where Helvetra Wins

privacy.title: Privacy as a Foundation, Not a Feature
privacy.p1: This is the fundamental difference between us. Google Translate is a free service because you pay with your data. Your translations can be stored, analyzed, and used to train Google's AI models. For casual use — looking up a word, translating a menu — this is a fair trade for most people.
privacy.p2: But what about translating a confidential business email? A legal document? Personal medical information? A love letter? This is where Helvetra's approach matters. We don't store your translations. We don't use them for training. They're processed on Swiss servers by Swiss AI and immediately deleted. Swiss privacy law — which is stricter than GDPR — applies to everything we do.

swissAi.title: Built on Swiss AI Technology
swissAi.p1: Helvetra is powered by Apertus, the Swiss large language model developed by ETH Zürich, EPFL, and the Swiss National Supercomputing Centre. This isn't just a badge — it's a fundamentally different approach to AI. Apertus is open-source, research-driven, and built for transparency rather than profit extraction.
swissAi.p2: When you use Helvetra, you're supporting the Swiss technology ecosystem instead of feeding more data to Big Tech. Your translations help fund Swiss research and infrastructure, not advertising algorithms in California.

swissGerman.title: The Only Swiss German Translator
swissGerman.p1: Google Translate doesn't support Swiss German. Neither does DeepL, Microsoft Translator, or any other major translation service. Helvetra is currently the only tool that can translate to and from Swiss German, with support for regional dialects like Zürich, Bern, Basel, and more. The quality is still improving — Swiss German is genuinely hard — but we're the only ones working on it.

simplicity.title: Simplicity by Design
simplicity.p1: Helvetra does one thing: translate text. There's no account required for basic use, no ads, no dark patterns trying to upsell you, no features you'll never use cluttering the interface. Google Translate has grown increasingly complex over the years — conversation mode, camera translation, saved translations, starred phrases, integration with dozens of other services. If you just want to paste some text and get a translation, Helvetra gets out of your way.

helvetraWins.verdict: Bottom line: If you work primarily with Swiss languages, care about where your data goes, or simply want a clean translation tool without the complexity, Helvetra was built for you.

privacyTradeoff.title: The Privacy Trade-off (Honestly)
privacyTradeoff.intro: Let's be direct about what "free" means for each service. Google Translate is free because your usage data has value to Google — for improving their AI, for understanding language patterns, for building better products. Helvetra's free tier exists to let you try the service, with a paid tier for heavy users. Here's exactly what each service collects:

googleCollects.title: What Google collects
googleCollects.point1: Your translation history (stored in your Google account unless you turn this off)
googleCollects.point2: Translation data used to improve Google's machine learning models
googleCollects.point3: Subject to US law, including the CLOUD Act which allows government data requests

helvetraCollects.title: What Helvetra collects
helvetraCollects.point1: Nothing. Translations are processed and immediately deleted from our servers.
helvetraCollects.point2: The only exception: if you voluntarily submit feedback, we store that specific translation to improve quality.

privacyTradeoff.honestTruth: Here's the honest truth: if you don't care about privacy, Google's data collection will be completely invisible to you. The service works great. But if you're translating anything sensitive — business documents, legal text, personal correspondence — you should know where that data goes and who can access it.

chooseGoogle.title: Choose Google Translate if:
chooseGoogle.point1: You need languages beyond German, French, Italian, English, and Swiss German
chooseGoogle.point2: You translate casually and aren't concerned about data privacy
chooseGoogle.point3: You want camera translation, voice input, or conversation mode
chooseGoogle.point4: You're already invested in Google's ecosystem and value the integration

chooseHelvetra.title: Choose Helvetra if:
chooseHelvetra.point1: You work primarily with Swiss languages and want optimized quality
chooseHelvetra.point2: Privacy matters — for business, legal, or personal reasons
chooseHelvetra.point3: You need Swiss German translation (we're the only option)
chooseHelvetra.point4: You prefer a simple, focused tool over a feature-packed platform
chooseHelvetra.point5: You want to support Swiss technology instead of Big Tech

conclusion.title: The Bottom Line
conclusion.p1: Google Translate is an incredible tool. It's free, it's everywhere, and it handles 133 languages with impressive quality. For casual use and global language coverage, nothing beats it. We're not trying to compete with that.
conclusion.p2: Helvetra exists for a different purpose: to give Swiss users a translation tool that respects their privacy, supports their languages (including Swiss German), and keeps their data in Switzerland. If that matters to you, we built this for you.
conclusion.p3: The best translation tool is the one that fits your values and your needs. Now you have the information to choose.
conclusion.cta: Ready to try a translation tool that respects your privacy?

meta.title: Helvetra vs DeepL: Which Translator Is Right for You?
meta.description: An honest comparison of Helvetra and DeepL. We break down quality, pricing, Swiss German support, and data privacy to help you choose the right translation tool.

deepl.title: Helvetra vs DeepL
deepl.subtitle: DeepL has earned its reputation for quality. But is it the right choice for Swiss users? Here's an honest look at what each tool does best.

intro.p1: DeepL has built a well-deserved reputation as one of the best translation tools available. Its translations often read more naturally than competitors, especially for European languages. When DeepL launched, it genuinely raised the bar for machine translation quality.
intro.p2: So why would anyone choose Helvetra over DeepL? Not because we claim to be better at everything — we're not. But because we solve different problems. If you work primarily with Swiss languages, care deeply about data sovereignty, or need Swiss German, Helvetra offers something DeepL simply can't. Let's break down the honest differences.

deeplWins.title: Where DeepL Wins

quality.title: Translation Quality for European Languages
quality.p1: DeepL's neural network produces remarkably natural-sounding translations, particularly between major European languages like German, French, English, and Spanish. In blind tests, users often prefer DeepL's output over Google Translate and other competitors. The translations feel less mechanical and capture nuance better.
quality.p2: This quality comes from years of focused development and massive training datasets. For straightforward German-English or French-Spanish translation, DeepL is genuinely excellent. We won't pretend otherwise.

documents.title: Document Translation
documents.p1: DeepL handles entire documents — Word files, PowerPoints, PDFs — while preserving formatting. Upload a 50-page report and get it back translated with layout intact. Helvetra currently focuses on text translation only. If you regularly need to translate formatted documents, DeepL's document handling is a significant advantage.

api.title: Developer API
api.p1: DeepL offers a robust API for developers who want to integrate translation into their applications. The documentation is solid, and the service is reliable. Helvetra doesn't currently offer an API (though it's on our roadmap). If you're building software that needs translation capabilities, DeepL is the practical choice today.

languages.title: Broader Language Coverage
languages.p1: DeepL supports 31+ languages compared to Helvetra's 5. Need Japanese, Portuguese, or Polish? DeepL has you covered. Helvetra focuses exclusively on Swiss languages: German, French, Italian, English, and Swiss German. This is intentional — we'd rather do five languages excellently than thirty adequately.

deeplWins.verdict: Bottom line: DeepL is a premium translation tool that deserves its reputation. For European language quality, document translation, and API access, it's an excellent choice.

helvetraWins.title: Where Helvetra Wins

swissGerman.title: Swiss German Translation
swissGerman.p1: DeepL doesn't support Swiss German. Neither does Google Translate, Microsoft Translator, or any other major translation service. Helvetra is the only tool that can translate to and from Swiss German, with support for regional dialects including Zürich, Bern, Basel, Aargau, and more.
swissGerman.p2: If you need to translate a Mundart message from a colleague, communicate with Swiss German-speaking family members, or localize content for Swiss audiences, we're your only option. Swiss German is genuinely challenging — it varies significantly by region and has no standardized written form — but we're actively improving our dialect support.

privacy.title: Swiss Data Sovereignty
privacy.p1: DeepL is a German company, which means your data is subject to EU regulations and stored in EU data centers. That's better than US-based services, but it's not Swiss. For Swiss businesses, professionals, and privacy-conscious individuals, the difference matters.
privacy.p2: Helvetra processes all translations in Switzerland using Swiss AI (Apertus) on Swiss infrastructure (Infomaniak). Your text never leaves Switzerland. Swiss privacy law applies. For sensitive business communications, legal documents, or personal correspondence, this is more than a technicality — it's peace of mind.

pricing.title: Simpler, Affordable Pricing
pricing.p1: DeepL's pricing starts at €8.99/month for the Starter plan, which gives you 200K characters. Want more? The Advanced plan is €29.99/month. Need unlimited? That's €59.99/month. The free tier is generous (50K characters/month) but the jump to paid is steep.
pricing.p2: Helvetra+ costs CHF 4.99/month and gives you 500,000 characters — that's more than DeepL's €29.99 Advanced plan at roughly one-sixth the price. No complex tier structure, no feature gating. Just one straightforward plan for people who translate regularly.

simplicity.title: Focused Simplicity
simplicity.p1: DeepL has grown into a feature-rich platform with glossaries, formality settings, document translation, team features, and API access. If you need those features, they're valuable. But if you just want to translate text quickly and privately, all that complexity is noise. Helvetra does one thing: translate text for Swiss languages. No account required for basic use, no upsell pressure, no features you'll never touch.

helvetraWins.verdict: Bottom line: If Swiss German support, Swiss data sovereignty, or affordable pricing for heavy use matters to you, Helvetra was built specifically for your needs.

qualityQuestion.title: The Quality Question
qualityQuestion.intro: Let's address this directly: is Helvetra's translation quality as good as DeepL's? For standard European language pairs, DeepL has a head start — years of development and massive training data. But quality depends on what you're translating and for whom.

deeplQuality.title: DeepL's strengths
deeplQuality.point1: Polished output for major European language pairs
deeplQuality.point2: Better handling of complex sentence structures

helvetraQuality.title: Helvetra's strengths
helvetraQuality.point2: Optimized for Swiss context and terminology

qualityQuestion.honestTruth: The honest truth: for a German-French business email, both tools produce good results. DeepL might edge ahead on literary prose. But for anything involving Swiss German or Swiss-specific context, Helvetra is your only real option — and we're working hard to close any quality gap in other areas.

pricingSection.title: Pricing Breakdown
pricingSection.intro: Translation tools vary wildly in how they charge. Here's a direct comparison of what you get for your money:

helvetraPricing.title: Helvetra Pricing
helvetraPricing.point3: No complex tiers or feature gating

pricingSection.conclusion: DeepL's free tier is more generous (50K vs 20K characters). But if you translate regularly and need a paid plan, Helvetra+ offers the same character limit as DeepL Advanced at one-sixth the price. The question is whether DeepL's additional features — document translation, API access, glossaries — are worth the premium for your use case.

chooseDeepL.title: Choose DeepL if:
chooseDeepL.point1: You need document translation with preserved formatting
chooseDeepL.point2: You're integrating translation into software via API
chooseDeepL.point3: You work with languages beyond German, French, Italian, and English
chooseDeepL.point4: Quality for complex literary or technical prose is paramount

chooseHelvetra.title: Choose Helvetra if:
chooseHelvetra.point1: You need Swiss German translation (we're the only option)
chooseHelvetra.point2: Data sovereignty matters — Swiss servers, Swiss law
chooseHelvetra.point3: You want affordable pricing for high-volume translation
chooseHelvetra.point4: You prefer simplicity over features you won't use
chooseHelvetra.point5: You want to support Swiss technology over Big Tech

conclusion.title: The Bottom Line
conclusion.p1: DeepL is an excellent translation tool. Its quality for major European languages is industry-leading, and features like document translation and API access are valuable for professional users. If you need those capabilities, it's worth the premium.
conclusion.p2: Helvetra exists for a different purpose: to serve Swiss users who need Swiss German support, want their data to stay in Switzerland, or simply want an affordable, focused translation tool without the complexity. We're not trying to replace DeepL for everyone — we're building the best option for users whose needs align with our strengths.
conclusion.p3: The right choice depends on your priorities. Now you have the information to decide.
conclusion.cta: Ready to try translation built for Switzerland?

meta.title: Helvetra vs Supertext: Two Swiss Translation Services Compared
meta.description: Comparing two Swiss translation services: Helvetra and Supertext. We analyze pricing, features, and the surprising Swiss German gap to help you choose.

supertext.title: Helvetra vs Supertext
supertext.subtitle: Two Swiss companies, two different approaches to translation. One focuses on enterprise clients with human review. The other focuses on everyday users with AI speed. Here's how they compare.

intro.p1: Supertext is a well-established Swiss translation company based in Zurich. They offer a combination of AI-powered translation and human proofreading, targeting businesses and professionals who need polished, publication-ready content. Their client list includes major Swiss brands.
intro.p2: Helvetra takes a different approach. We focus on instant AI translation for everyday users who need quick, private results without the overhead of professional services. Both companies are Swiss, both care about quality, but we serve different needs. Let's break down where each service shines.

supertextWins.title: Where Supertext Wins

human.title: Human Proofreading Option
human.p1: Supertext's key differentiator is their network of professional translators and editors. After AI generates an initial translation, human experts can review and polish the text. For marketing copy, legal documents, or anything that will be published, this human touch catches nuances that AI might miss.
human.p2: If you need guaranteed accuracy for high-stakes content, having a human expert review your translation provides peace of mind that pure AI cannot match.

enterprise.title: Enterprise Features
enterprise.p1: Supertext offers team accounts, translation memory, glossaries, and project management tools. Large organizations with ongoing translation needs benefit from these workflow features. They also provide dedicated account managers for enterprise clients.

languages.title: Broader Language Coverage
languages.p1: Supertext supports 28 languages compared to Helvetra's 5. If you regularly need translations involving Portuguese, Japanese, Arabic, or other languages outside the Swiss national languages, Supertext has broader coverage.

formats.title: Document Format Support
formats.p1: Supertext handles various file formats including Word documents, PowerPoints, and PDFs with layout preservation. Their subscription plans are based on file counts rather than character limits, which suits document-heavy workflows.

supertextWins.verdict: Bottom line: Supertext excels at professional, high-stakes translation where human review and enterprise features justify the premium pricing.

helvetraWins.title: Where Helvetra Wins

swissGerman.title: Swiss German Support
swissGerman.p1: Here's the irony: Supertext is a Swiss company, headquartered in Zurich, yet they don't support Swiss German. Their 28 languages include standard German but not the dialect spoken by millions of Swiss people every day.
swissGerman.p2: Helvetra is currently the only translation service that supports Swiss German, with dialect options for Zurich, Bern, Basel, and other regions. If you need to translate Mundart messages or communicate in Swiss German, we're your only option.

pricing.title: Dramatically Lower Pricing
pricing.p1: Supertext's cheapest plan starts at CHF 9.90/month for 20 files. Their Advanced plan is CHF 24.90/month, and Pro is CHF 49.90/month. These prices make sense for businesses with regular professional translation needs.
pricing.p2: Helvetra+ costs CHF 4.99/month and gives you 500,000 characters of instant translation. For casual users, students, or anyone who doesn't need human proofreading, this represents significant savings.

instant.title: Instant Results
instant.p1: Helvetra provides translation in seconds. Type or paste your text, get your translation immediately. No waiting for human reviewers, no project queues, no turnaround times. For quick communication needs, instant beats polished.

simplicity.title: No-Frills Simplicity
simplicity.p1: Supertext's platform is built for professional workflows with features most casual users will never touch. Helvetra is intentionally simple: paste text, get translation, done. No account required for basic use, no learning curve, no complexity.

helvetraWins.verdict: Bottom line: Helvetra wins on Swiss German support, pricing, speed, and simplicity. If you don't need human proofreading, you get more for less.

swissGermanIrony.title: The Swiss German Question
swissGermanIrony.intro: Let's address the elephant in the room. Supertext is a proudly Swiss company, founded in Zurich, serving Swiss clients. Yet they don't support Swiss German. Why? Because Swiss German is genuinely difficult for translation services.

supertext.title: Why Supertext skips Swiss German
supertext.point1: No standardized written form makes training AI models challenging
supertext.point2: Regional variations (Zurich vs Bern vs Basel) multiply complexity
supertext.point3: Their human translators work with standard written languages

helvetra.title: Why Helvetra tackles it anyway
helvetra.point1: Swiss German is core to Swiss identity, someone needs to solve it
helvetra.point2: Apertus (Swiss AI) was trained with Swiss German data
helvetra.point3: We offer dialect selection to handle regional variations

swissGermanIrony.conclusion: We won't claim our Swiss German translation is perfect. It's a hard problem. But we're the only ones working on it, and we're improving with every user feedback submission.

pricingSection.title: Pricing Comparison
pricingSection.intro: The pricing models are fundamentally different. Supertext charges by files, targeting document workflows. Helvetra charges by characters, targeting text translation.

helvetraPricing.title: Helvetra Pricing
helvetraPricing.point3: No file limits, just character counts

pricingSection.conclusion: For document-heavy professional use, Supertext's file-based pricing might make sense. For everyday text translation, Helvetra's character-based model is more economical and predictable.

chooseSupertext.title: Choose Supertext if:
chooseSupertext.point1: You need human proofreading for publication-ready content
chooseSupertext.point2: You're a business with ongoing professional translation needs
chooseSupertext.point3: You need languages beyond German, French, Italian, and English
chooseSupertext.point4: You want enterprise features like glossaries and team accounts

chooseHelvetra.title: Choose Helvetra if:
chooseHelvetra.point1: You need Swiss German translation (only option available)
chooseHelvetra.point2: You want instant results without waiting for human review
chooseHelvetra.point4: You translate casually and don't need professional polish
chooseHelvetra.point5: Privacy matters and you want Swiss AI processing

conclusion.title: The Bottom Line
conclusion.p1: Supertext and Helvetra serve different markets. Supertext is a professional translation service for businesses who need human-reviewed, publication-quality content. Their pricing and features reflect this enterprise focus.
conclusion.p2: Helvetra is for everyone else: people who need quick, private translation for everyday communication. We're faster, cheaper, simpler, and we're the only ones supporting Swiss German. If you don't need human proofreaders, you don't need to pay for them.
conclusion.p3: Both are Swiss companies committed to quality. The right choice depends on whether you need professional polish or everyday convenience.
conclusion.cta: Ready for instant Swiss translation without the enterprise price tag?
